title: Finalizing and Generating Product from APD in policycenter
sourceFile: Finalizing and Generating Product from APD in policycenter.docx

bodyParagraphs.text: Product Finalization Overview
After you have refined and enhanced the insurance product, you are ready to finalize the
product in Policycenter.
Finalization is the phase where the visualized product is used to generate the artifacts
needed for Policycenter including user interface elements, product model, and entities.
The result is an installed product.
Step 1
Adding and Reviewing Metadata
1. Add metadata to all elements in the product model tree.
a. Ensure that they follow Guidewire suggested standards, or standards agreed
upon by the project team members.
2. Review all content.
step 2
Setting the Package Name for the Generated Product
Line Gosu Files
Set the APDProductLinesGosuPackage script parameter.
step 3
Validating and Generating the Product
1. Validate the product definition.
2. Generate the product code to create the product.
3. Restart PolicyCenter.
Product Metadata
Metadata is visible if the Product Design Mode is Designer or above.
The fields labeled (*PD) are metadata fields.
• You must add metadata in all the fields labeled (*PD) for product generation.
These fields are not required to visualize the product.
The metadata includes business descriptions and short names.
The product model is not valid until all metadata has been entered-
Product Metadata: Short Name (*PD)
In Product Design Mode as Developer, the Product Definition screens display the Short
Name (*PD) fields. These fields must be filled in before generating the product.
Clauses and clause terms
Line, risk object, and exposure
Attributes
Typelists
Typelist options
Finalize
PolicyCenter
Code Identifier
Entity names
Column names
Typelist names
Typecodes
After finalizing the product, short names translate into entity names, column names, typelists, typecodes, and so on in PolicyCenter Studio.

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IF66137466A9B0377E55D41E3C73BA8D0514370B4C53E2E92B85D5836674B545B/media/86996452/V13/lesson-4-a-finalizing-and-generating-product-from-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/MindMap_SN.png
Adding Short Names:
You can add short names by:
• Setting Default additional fields? toyeswhile importing a mind map, to automatically
create the (*PD)fields.
o The default short names are created automatically by concatenating the labels.
o If the label is longer than the allowed character limit, a default short name is
created. These defaulted values must be updated before finalizing the product.
• Defining short names in the mind map.
o For all topics with markers (except product and product line) in the mind map,
short names can be specified in a label.
o The label becomes the Short Name (*PD) in PolicyCenter.
• Adding Short Name (*PD) values in the visualized product screens directly.
Short Name (*PD) Requirements:
The Short Name (*PD) fields:
• Must start with an uppercase letter and must include only letters, digits, S or
• Cannot have spaces
• Must be unique - Uniqueness of short name depends on the type of object
o Clauses and clause category - Must be unique within the product line
o Clause terms - Must be unique within the parent clause
o Risk objects and exposures - Attributes within the same risk object or exposure
must be unique
Typelist names must be unique
o In the Developer mode, the short names for the drop-down lists can be
specified in the Typelist (*PD) field
• Cannot be Java or Gosu keywords, anda few database keywords
• Have character limits that are enforced in the user interface
o If you import a mind map or template where short names exceed the character
limits, the short names are truncated
Reference:
For more details on this topic, refer to the Guidewire Documentation site and search for Metadata.
Best Practices for Adding Short Names:
Create short names that follow best-practice naming conventions agreed upon by the
organization or team.
ENTITY NAME		ENTITY ATTRIBUTE		TYPELIST	  TYPECODE
• Entity declaration names must begin with a capital letter, with the first letter of each
ntimal word capitalized.
• Fornew product model entities that are generated using Advanced Product Designer,
short names should not be appended with the _ Ext suffix-
Do not append with Line Prefix, as the entities get appended with Line Prefix after
code generation.
Example:
Entity short name: SimpleSmallBusiness
Generated entity: SSBSimpleSmallBusiness, where SSB is Line Prefix
Steps to Manually Add Metadata in the Visualized Product Screens
Exercise:
Add short names to the visualized product.
Demonstration:  Product Metadata Short Name.mp4
Getting Ready for Product Generation
Before starting the product generation:
1.Set Product Design Mode to Developer.
• Product can be generated only in the Developer mode.
2.Define the Gosu package that will contain the Gosu classes for the product
lines.
The APDProductLinesGosuPackage script parameter defines the package in
which PolicyCenter generates Gosu files for your product lines.
The default value is ext.lob, and the package is created in gsrc.
3.(Optionally) If it is not already there, move the product to the PolicyCenter
instance where it will be generated, tested, and deployed.
Steps to Set APDProductLinesGosuPackage Script Parameter
Steps to Move Product
Validate and Generate Product
After adding metadata, you are ready to validate and generate the product, and are ready to
deploy it onto the Guidewire Cloud Platform.
You can validate and generate product in:
An instance of PolicyCenter that runs on your local machine
Policycenter running on the Guidewire Cloud Platform
The product model is not valid until all metadata has been entered-
Generate Product Code Locally, and Deploy Product onto Guidewire Cloud Platform
Following illustration shows the process for generating the product code on a local
instance of Policycenter , and then deploying the generated product onto Guidewire Cloud
Platform to various PolicyCenter instances, such as Dev 1, Dev 2, and so on.

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IF66137466A9B0377E55D41E3C73BA8D0514370B4C53E2E92B85D5836674B545B/media/86996452/V13/lesson-4-a-finalizing-and-generating-product-from-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/Finalization_on_Local_Machine_Final_v2.png
Exercise:
Validate and generate the Simple small Business product on your local machine.
Demonstration: Validate and Generate Product.mp4
Generate, and Deploy Product on Guidewire Cloud Platform
The following illustration shows the process for generating and deploying a product
directly on Guidewire Cloud Platform to various Policycenter instances, such as Dev 1, Dev
2, and so on.

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IF66137466A9B0377E55D41E3C73BA8D0514370B4C53E2E92B85D5836674B545B/media/86996452/V13/lesson-4-a-finalizing-and-generating-product-from-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/Finalization_on_GWCP_Final.png
Demonstration: Validate and Generate Product 2.mp4
Installed Product
The code generation process generates the artifacts needed for Policycenter including:
• User interface elements (page configuration files)
• Product model
• Entity model
Generating a product creates files in the config and gsrc directory of PolicyCenter.
For more details on this topic, refer to the Guidewire Documentation site and search for Generated product
files.
Visualization Items Excluded from the Generated Product
The following parts of the visualized product are not generated into the product:
The rate in pricing
Event data
Editions containing the product model properties and subclause (parent-child
clause) relationships
Risk Details in the Installed Product
In the installed product, the Risk Details screen layout uses certain rules for displaying
risk objects, exposures, and coverages.
Reference:
To view rules for displaying risk objects, exposures, and coverages in the installed product, refer to
the Guidewire Documentation site and search for Displaying Risk Details in generated product.
Regenerating Product
After generatingyour product, you can continue product development in Guidewire Studio
and Product Designer while simultaneously making changes in Advanced Product
Designer.
To update the installed product, you need to regenerate it.
When you click Generate Product Code, Advanced Product Designer displays a warning for
certain types of modified files, that will be ovetwritten if proceeded with regeneration.
Reference.
For more details on the types of files affected during product regeneration, refer to the Guidewire
Documentation site and search for Regenerating the product
Loading Editions into the Installed Product
Editions contain the product model properties and subclause (parent-child clause)
relationships. After generating the product, you can load editions into that product.
Editions Lifecycle and Management

https://education.guidewire.com/content-server/secure/045D6714034EE7IF66137466A9B0377E55D41E3C73BA8D0514370B4C53E2E92B85D5836674B545B/media/86996452/V13/lesson-4-a-finalizing-and-generating-product-from-apd-in-policy-center-scorm/scormcontent/assets/Editions_Lifecycle_Management_v1.png
You create editions in the visualized product line.
The product template contains all the editions.
The editions are stored in the Policycenter database after loading the product
template into the installed product.
With editions, you can make changes to the product model properties and to
the subclause relationships in an installed product, without restarting the
server.
For example, making a coverage unavailable or changing the parent of a clause.
Structural changes require regenerating the product code and restarting the
server.
For example, adding a new coverage, adding anew field, changing the name of
a risk object, and so on.
Note:
Even though you can make these structural changes while editing a particular
edition, the structural changes apply to all editions.
Loading Editions
Editions are loaded from the product template into an installed product. Loading editions is a two-step process:
Preload editions - All the editions from the product template are loaded, but
are not used yet.
Activate editions - Editions are active and are used in policy transactions.
• In a production server, you cannot activate preloaded editions if there are
issues requiring attention in the product template.
• In a development or test senrer, you can choose to activate the preloaded
editions even if the product template contains issues requiring attention. You
can control this with the APDBlockInvalidEditionsInDev script parameter.
Load editions to an installed product
Exercise:
Load the editions in the Simple Small Business installed product.
Demonstration:  Installed product.mp4
